candidates.name: Leigh Manson
candidates.why_elect: I believe healthcare services have traditionally not been designed to support people to be who they value being and do what the value doing. I want to see this change so that what really matters to people drives the design and delivery of services.
candidates.why_stand: Since I was a girl I have wanted to make the world a better place and have spent most of my adult life improving the experience of, access to and quality of healthcare services. I want to use my experience and skills to improve the services our DHB offers.

candidates.name: Paul Matheson
candidates.why_elect: I have a history of community engagement from rotary to school boards, commerce and conservation. I believe I know my community well.
candidates.why_stand: I have extensive governance experience running Nelson city and wish to share this in the health sector.

candidates.name: Garth Munro
candidates.why_elect: My clinical background and health management experience in strategic governance will enable me to quickly understand and guide the NMDHB towards a more efficient and clinically appropriate direction for the people of the region.
candidates.why_stand: I have over thirty years of clinical and health management experience in both the Private and Public/Hospital Health sector and seek to utilise this experience and energy to improve the health services in the Nelson/Tasman/Marlborough region.

candidates.name: Jacinta Newport
candidates.why_elect: I am a long term Nelson resident and experienced PHC nurse. I have extensive experience working in this region and also have extended my practice to embrace indigenous healthcare in Australia in remote settings. I have a special interest in chronic pain.
candidates.why_stand: I see flaws in the current delivery of health care services in our region and with my background as a rural Nurse Specialist and Primary health care nurse would like to contribute to the discussion on how to improve better health services for all and especially those with significant disability.

candidates.name: Allan Panting
candidates.why_elect: Although having practised as a surgeon, I have a very good understanding of the wider issues of healthcare. I don't have any particular agendas other than ensuring we base our health care upon sound supporting evidence.
candidates.why_stand: With a background strong in clinical and leadership experience, and having served one term as a Board member, I believe I can contribute to the Nelson Marlborough District Health Board.

candidates.name: Ian Pirie
candidates.why_elect: I am honest and diligent and have a track record of achievement. I make commonsense decisions and believe we have a great health system that needs improvement and structural tweaking. I am particularly interested in the outcomes of the government review currently being undertaken. I have leadership and governance experience.
candidates.why_stand: I have a background in emergency air ambulance services, leadership and board experience is these areas and would like to put my knowledge and experience to work for our Marlborough and Nelson/Tasman communities.

candidates.name: Stephen Vallance
candidates.why_elect: Having worked in health care all my working life I understand the difficulties of providing health services. I have extensive experience on professional and other committees and boards. I know how strongly the Marlborough community feels about it's local health services.
candidates.why_stand: I love Marlborough. I worked as a surgeon at the Hospital for 24 years. I am passionate to ensure high quality services are maintained locally.

candidates.name: Brigid Forrest
candidates.why_elect: Experience and reality as I am still working on the health system.
candidates.why_stand: I feel that I have significant experience and understanding of the health system to be able to offer good feedback and governance. Health provision will always be a financial balancing act between modern advances in diagnosis and treatment so we need to encourage better health literacy and equity for all.

candidates.name: Bernie Goldsmith
candidates.why_elect: I was raised by my grandparents. I was the moko that looked after my sick nanny when everyone else went out to play. Caring is in my heart and soul. I bring to the table honesty, integrity, frugal spending and practical common sense approach to problem solving.
candidates.why_stand: Kia ora, I stood because I'd heard that there were two compulsory Māori positions for the NMDHB and I thought the 'odds' were in my favour. I then heard no Māori have been elected from community votes and government elects their Māori mates in the area. NOOOO $200 deposit lost.

candidates.name: John Hutton
candidates.why_elect: The level of oversight for a half-billion $ budget requires experience in policy and organisational development, governance, and strategic visioning. Having worked in many international, multi-billion $ companies, I have that level of experience. My MBA (economics) and consulting background give me an excellent background for the DHB governance.
candidates.why_stand: Running a $530 million DHB budget is big business requiring executive management oversight and future strategic development skills and capability in large organisations. I want to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of our health-care system to ensure that our money is used wisely, delivering the best outcomes possible for all.
